Record.ClassificationPath: Digestive System Diseases/Pancreatic Diseases/Exocrine Pancreatic Insufficiency
Record.Description: A malabsorption condition resulting from greater than 10% reduction in the secretion of pancreatic digestive enzymes (LIPASE; PROTEASES; and AMYLASE) by the EXOCRINE PANCREAS into the DUODENUM. This condition is often associated with CYSTIC FIBROSIS and with chronic PANCREATITIS.
